item.title: 雪花调查异常迅速地逮捕了嫌犯
item.description: 嗨，我是马吉。回想起雪花黑客，最让我印象深刻的是调查员们是如何迅速取得成果的。但首先...【原文：Hi, it’s Margi. When I think about the Snowflake hack, one of the most striking things to me is how quickly investigators got results. But first…】

item.title: 摩根大通、AT&T 在反犹太主义指控后撤下 Twitch 广告
item.description: 据知情人士透露，三大品牌已停止在亚马逊公司的 Twitch 在线服务上投放广告，因为一群有争议的直播者指控该公司正在推广反犹太主义内容。【原文：Three major brands have halted their advertising on Amazon.com Inc.’s Twitch online service, according to people with knowledge of the matter, after a controversial group of livestreamers alleged that the company is promoting antisemitic content.】

item.title: 加拿大油砂之乡追逐 710 亿美元数据中心商机
item.description: 加拿大阿尔伯塔省拥有世界第三大原油储量，该省正在努力成为人工智能数据中心的枢纽，并认为有潜力吸引 1000 亿加元（约合 710 亿美元）的投资。【原文：The Canadian province of Alberta, home to the world’s third-largest crude reserves, is making a push to become a hub for artificial intelligence data centers and sees the potential to attract C$100 billion ($71 billion) in investments.】

item.title: 拉加德表示，欧洲必须调整资本市场联盟工作的重点
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德在为《经济学人》撰写的专栏文章中说，欧盟需要加大力度统一其分散的金融基础设施。【原文：The European Union needs to ramp up efforts to unify its fragmented financial infrastructure, European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said in an op-ed for the Economist.】

item.title: 电动汽车公司 Ideanomics 在与美国证券交易委员会达成和解后申请破产
item.description: Ideanomics 公司拥有为电动公交车和其他商用车充电的技术，在证券监管机构指控其高管在财务业绩方面误导投资者数月后，该公司已申请破产。【原文：Ideanomics Inc., which owns technology used to charge electric buses and other commercial vehicles, has filed bankruptcy months after securities regulators accused its executives of misleading investors about its financial performance.】

item.title: 特朗普推选前证监会委员阿特金斯接替根斯勒
item.description: 保罗-阿特金斯（Paul Atkins）是一位资深的金融监管者，也是华盛顿保守派金融界的常客，他是当选总统唐纳德-特朗普领导美国证券交易委员会并可能对其进行全面改革的人选。【原文：Paul Atkins, a veteran financial regulator and a fixture in Washington’s conservative financial circles, is President-elect Donald Trump’s choice to lead and possibly overhaul the US Securities and Exchange Commission.】

item.title: 红宝石收益测试临近，企业关注数据安全支出
item.description: Rubrik 公司本周四发布的第三季度财报是决定其股价是否有更大上涨空间的关键因素。【原文：Rubrik Inc.’s third-quarter results on Thursday are a crucial factor in whether its stock price has more room to run, having already jumped more than 50% since the last release.】

item.title: 维托尔、嘉能可看中新富通公司的牙买加液化天然气资产
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，维托尔集团和嘉能可集团（Glencore Plc.）正在考虑收购新堡垒能源公司（New Fortress Energy Inc.【原文：Vitol Group and Glencore Plc. are considering acquiring New Fortress Energy Inc.’s Jamaican LNG assets, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚亲欧盟政党同意联合抵制极右翼势力
item.description: 罗马尼亚的亲欧洲政党签署了一项组建联盟的协议，试图在周日举行的第二轮总统选举前阻止民族主义势力掌权。【原文：Romania’s pro-European parties signed a deal to form a coalition in an attempt to keep nationalist forces out of power ahead of a presidential election run-off on Sunday that has a Russia-friendly candidate as the front-runner.】

item.title: 特朗普任命万斯助手盖尔-斯莱特为司法部反垄断高级官员
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）已选择牛津大学毕业、曾担任美国当选副总统万斯（JD Vance）经济政策顾问的盖尔-斯莱特（Gail Slater）担任司法部反垄断执法部门负责人。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump has selected Gail Slater, an Oxford-educated economic policy adviser to Vice President-elect JD Vance, to head up antitrust enforcement at the Justice Department.】

item.title: 环球人寿股价因卖空者声称 "空置办公室 "而下挫
item.description: 环球人寿公司（Globe Life Inc.【原文：Globe Life Inc. shares fell after a short seller said its American Income Life unit appears to have shuttered several major offices.】

item.title: 战锤制造商登上英国富时 100 指数，零售商纷纷退出
item.description: 战锤开发商游戏工作室集团公司（Games Workshop Group Plc）和投资信托公司联盟威坦公司（Alliance Witan Plc）的股票飙升至历史新高，首次获得英国蓝筹股地位。【原文：Warhammer developer Games Workshop Group Plc and investment trust Alliance Witan Plc earned UK blue-chip status for the first time after both stocks soared to record highs.】

item.title: 纳格尔称欧洲央行不应将利率降至中性以下
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）认为，欧洲中央银行可以逐步降低借贷成本，使其不再限制经济活动，但不应走得太远。【原文：The European Central Bank can gradually lower its borrowing costs to levels that no longer restrict economic activity but shouldn’t go too far, according to Governing Council member Joachim Nagel.】

item.title: 特朗普任命福尔肯德为贝森特的财政部副部长
item.description: 当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）挑选了金融学教授迈克尔-福尔肯德（Michael Faulkender）担任财政部副部长。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump selected finance professor Michael Faulkender — who implemented a key pandemic-era relief program during his first presidency — to be the deputy Treasury secretary.】

item.title: 特鲁多的移民计划取决于数百万人的离开
item.description: 贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）总理解决加拿大移民问题的计划取决于至少自 20 世纪 40 年代以来最大规模的人口外流；许多经济学家怀疑这一计划是否可行。【原文：Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s plan to fix immigration in Canada depends on the biggest exodus of people since at least the 1940s — one that many economists doubt is feasible.】

item.title: 新日铁仍有信心完成遭到广泛反对的美国交易
item.description: 新日本制铁公司（Nippon Steel Corp.）重申，尽管美国现任和下任总统反对收购，但该公司有信心在年底前完成对美国钢铁公司 141 亿美元的收购。【原文：Nippon Steel Corp. reiterated confidence that its $14.1 billion acquisition of United States Steel Corp. can be completed by year-end, even as the current and incoming US presidents oppose the takeover.】

item.title: 钻石销售疲软将使博茨瓦纳赤字扩大至占国内生产总值的 6.7
item.description: 财政部的估算草案显示，由于钻石收入锐减，博茨瓦纳本财政年度的预算赤字将增加一倍多，达到 186 亿普拉（14 亿美元），占国内生产总值的 6.7%。【原文：Botswana’s budget deficit for the current financial year will more than double to 18.6 billion pula ($1.4 billion), or 6.7% of gross domestic product, due to a sharp drop in diamond receipts, draft estimates from the Finance Ministry show.】

item.title: 特朗普财政部长人选将与共和党参议员会面，议程包括美联储和关税问题
item.description: 即将上任的参议院共和党领袖约翰-图恩（John Thune）表示，他希望在提名听证会之前讨论财政部长提名人斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）对关税和美联储的看法。【原文：Incoming Senate Republican leader John Thune said he expects to discuss Treasury secretary nominee Scott Bessent’s views on tariffs and the Federal Reserve ahead of nomination hearings.】

item.title: 研究发现，特朗普过去的关税政策损害了美国经济和股市
item.description: 根据纽约联邦储备银行最新发布的研究报告，当选总统唐纳德-特朗普第一任期内对中国征收的关税对美国经济产生了负面影响。【原文：Tariffs imposed on China during President-elect Donald Trump’s first term had negative effects for the US economy, according to newly released research from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.】

item.title: 出售给贝莱德后，HPS 为留住员工提供激励措施
item.description: 根据彭博新闻社看到的一封投资者信，HPS Investment Partners 将向员工提供五年内归属的补助金，以鼓励他们在被贝莱德收购后继续留任。【原文：HPS Investment Partners is offering employees grants that vest over five years to encourage them to stay on after being acquired by BlackRock, according to an investor letter seen by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: OpenAI 首席执行官认为马斯克不会利用政治力量对付对手
item.description: OpenAI首席执行官萨姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）驳斥了竞争对手埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）可能利用其新发现的政治影响力削弱竞争对手并为自己的人工智能努力谋利的担忧。【原文：OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman dismissed concerns that rival Elon Musk might use his newfound political influence to undercut competitors and benefit his own artificial intelligence efforts.】

item.title: 南非农场游说团在经历震荡下滑后开始审查农业数据
item.description: 南非最大的农场产业机构已委托对其数据进行审查，因为官方统计数据显示，农业部门的衰退程度远远超出了该机构的预期。【原文：South Africa’s largest farm-industry body has commissioned a review of its data after official statistics showed a much deeper slump in the agriculture sector than it had foreseen.】

item.title: 官员称肯尼亚可通过侨民债券筹资 38.6 亿美元
item.description: 肯尼亚一位高级官员表示，肯尼亚正在与世界银行的一个部门合作，通过发行侨民债券筹集多达 5000 亿先令（38.6 亿美元）的资金。【原文：Kenya is working with a World Bank unit to raise as much as 500 billion shillings ($3.86 billion) by issuing a diaspora bond, a top official said.】

item.title: 鲍威尔发表讲话前服务业指数疲软止住债券跌势
item.description: 美国服务业活动指数弱于预期，令美联储将在本月降息的押注升温，美国国债抛售陷入停滞。【原文：A selloff in US Treasuries stalled after a weaker-than-expected gauge of service-sector activity boosted bets the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates this month.】

item.title: Makhlouf 称地缘政治风险增加对爱尔兰不利
item.description: 爱尔兰中央银行行长周三表示，爱尔兰面临的地缘政治风险过大，并指出对国内经济至关重要的跨国公司数量过多。【原文：Ireland is disproportionately exposed to increased geopolitical risks, the Central Bank governor said Wednesday, pointing to the outsized number of multinational companies that are central to the domestic economy.】

item.title: 英国关闭转移寡头数十亿美元的俄罗斯加密货币网络
item.description: 英国警方表示，他们已经关闭了俄罗斯的网络，这些网络通过在欧洲、中东和南美将现金换成加密货币，为寡头、街头帮派和间谍转移了数十亿美元。【原文：UK police said they have shut down Russian networks that were moving billions of dollars for oligarchs, street gangs and spies by swapping cash for cryptocurrency across Europe, the Middle East and South America.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长拉加德称欧盟共同融资 "可取
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，她赞成欧盟为安全和气候转型等共同利益联合融资。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said she favors joint European Union financing for common goods such as security and climate transition.】

item.title: 美国服务业活动增速为三个月来最慢
item.description: 随着需求和就业增长的回落，11 月份美国服务业活动的扩张速度为三个月来最慢，这表明经济的最大组成部分正在失去动力。【原文：US services activity expanded in November at the slowest pace in three months as demand and employment growth settled back, indicating the largest part of the economy is losing momentum.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚人期待经济疲软和政治腐败加剧
item.description: 一项新的民意调查显示，哥伦比亚人对经济和政治阶层的可信度越来越感到悲观。【原文：Colombians are increasingly gloomy about both the economy and the trustworthiness of their political class, a new poll found.】

item.title: 物价上涨压倒经济强劲 卢拉支持率下降
item.description: 在巴西经济保持强劲的情况下，总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦的支持率却在下降，这凸显了在他进入任期后半段时，物价上涨和他本人的支出政策所带来的风险。【原文：President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s approval is declining even as Brazil’s economy remains strong, highlighting the risks rising prices and his own spending policies pose as he enters the second half of his term.】
